TypeSignature.Value: public delegate void DefaultAuthenticationEventHandler(object sender, DefaultAuthenticationEventArgs e);
.class public auto ansi sealed DefaultAuthenticationEventHandler extends System.MulticastDelegate
Public Delegate Sub DefaultAuthenticationEventHandler(sender As Object, e As DefaultAuthenticationEventArgs)
public delegate void DefaultAuthenticationEventHandler(System::Object ^ sender, DefaultAuthenticationEventArgs ^ e);
type DefaultAuthenticationEventHandler = delegate of obj * DefaultAuthenticationEventArgs -> unit

span.span: A that contains the event data.

summary.span: 表示处理 的 DefaultAuthentication_OnAuthenticate 事件的方法\*\*\*\*。

span.span: Represents the method that handles the **DefaultAuthentication_OnAuthenticate** event of a .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 委托是为类的事件定义的 。The delegate is defined for the event of the class. 可以 通过在 ASP.NET 应用程序的 global.asax 文件中指定名为 **DefaultAuthentication_OnAuthenticate** 的子程序来访问类的事件。You can access the event of the class by specifying a subroutine named **DefaultAuthentication_OnAuthenticate** in the Global.asax file for your ASP.NET application. 事件在事件后引发 ，并用于确保使用 对象填充当前的属性 。The event is raised after the event and is used to ensure that the property of the current is populated with an object. 您可以使用 提供给 **DefaultAuthentication_OnAuthenticate** 事件的对象的属性，将 当前的属性设置 为自定义 对象。You can use the property of the object supplied to the **DefaultAuthentication_OnAuthenticate** event to set the property of the current to a custom object. 如果未在 DefaultAuthentication_OnAuthenticate 事件期间为提供的属性指定值 ，则会**DefaultAuthentication_OnAuthenticate**将 的属性设置 为 不包含用户信息的对象。If you do not specify a value for the property of the supplied during the **DefaultAuthentication_OnAuthenticate** event, the sets the property of the to a object that contains no user information. 在**DefaultAuthentication_OnAuthenticate**事件之后 和事件之前引发 DefaultAuthentication_OnAuthenticate 事件 。The **DefaultAuthentication_OnAuthenticate** event is raised after the event and before the event. 如果某个节依赖于要拒绝的用户名或允许对应用程序的访问，则修改 当前的属性 可能会影响应用程序的行为。If you have an section that depends on the user name to deny or allow access to your application, modifying the property of the current can affect the behavior of your application. 在配置中指定节时，请确保考虑在 **DefaultAuthentication_OnAuthenticate** 事件中设置的用户名。Be sure that the user name you set during the **DefaultAuthentication_OnAuthenticate** event is considered when you specify the section in your configuration. ## Examples 下面的代码示例使用 **DefaultAuthentication_OnAuthenticate** 事件来测试 当前的属性是否 为 `null` 。The following code example uses the **DefaultAuthentication_OnAuthenticate** event to test whether the property of the current is `null`. 如果属性为 `null` ，则此示例将 当前的属性设置为一个 对象，其中对象的 是一个 值为 "default" 的。If the property is `null`, the sample sets the property of the current to a object, where the of the object is a with a value of "default". > [!NOTE] > 在事件前引发 **DefaultAuthentication_OnAuthenticate** 事件 。The **DefaultAuthentication_OnAuthenticate** event is raised before the event. 因此，如果将当前的属性设置 为自定义标识，则它可能会影响应用程序的行为。As a result, if you set the property of the current to a custom identity, it can affect the behavior of your application. 例如，如果您使用的是 类，并且您确保只有通过身份验证的用户才能访问您的站点，则通过使用部分并指定 `` ，此示例将导致元素被忽略，因为用户将具有一个名称，这是 "默认值"。For example, if you are using the class and you are ensuring that only authenticated users have access to your site, by using the section and specifying ``, this sample will cause the element to be ignored, as the user will have a name, which is "default". 相反，您需要指定 `` 以确保只有经过身份验证的用户才能访问您的站点。Instead you would specify `` to ensure that only authenticated users can access your site.
